sentences.english: Should I Tell my Boss About my Bipolar Disorder?
sentences.chinese: 我應該告訴我關於我的躁鬱症老闆嗎？

sentences.english: Mark Karppinen was afraid to tell his new girlfriend that he suffers from bipolar disorder.
sentences.chinese: 馬克很害怕告訴他的新女朋友他有躁鬱症。

sentences.english: Jung refers to tzu chi Ming has bipolar disorder, as a pretext to hurt the solar corona.
sentences.chinese: 日俊指志明有躁鬱症，並以此作爲藉口傷害日華。

sentences.english: She points out that an illness like bipolar disorder can be well-controlled on medication.
sentences.chinese: 她指出，躁鬱症疾病可以藥物的控制。

sentences.english: Hypomania is a feature of two mood disorders: bipolar II disorder and cyclothymia .
sentences.chinese: 輕躁狂是雙向情感障礙II型與躁鬱症的特徵。

sentences.english: Research studies suggest a strong genetic influence in bipolar disorder.
sentences.chinese: 調查研究表明，在躁鬱症強烈的遺傳影響。

sentences.english: I think I have schizoaffective disorder with bipolar tendencies.
sentences.chinese: 我的全部生活都被躁鬱症的痛苦折磨着。

definition: marginalized people (not part of mainstream society)/marginal man (term coined by social psychologist Kurt Lewin, referring to a person in transition between two cultures or social groups, not fully belonging to either)
sighing voice, wailing breath (idiom)/to heave deep sighs/to sigh in despair
Danny Lee Sau-Yin (1953-), Hong Kong actor and director
to use the past to disparage the present (idiom)
